Key Match Events: Kyle Hendricks pitched 7 1/3 shutout innings, yielding just two hits in a 3-0 victory over the Reds.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Hendricks expressed gratitude and reflected on his career with the Cubs, acknowledging the possibility of moving to another team.
Cubs manager Craig Counsell and pitching coach Tommy Hottovy shared emotional moments with Hendricks, highlighting their long-term relationship.
Ian Happ and other teammates celebrated Hendricks' career achievements in the clubhouse after the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kyle Hendricks is the last remaining player from the Cubs' 2016 World Series team.
Hendricks' 270 starts for the Cubs are tied for the ninth-most in team history.
Hendricks has a 3.68 ERA with 1,259 strikeouts and 364 walks in 1,580 1/3 innings for the Cubs.
Hendricks won the Major League ERA title (2.13) in 2016 and was part of five playoff teams, including the group that ended Chicago’s 108-year World Series drought.
